alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 2:29PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, Wallace and western Logan Counties in west central Kansas through 300 PM MDT/400 PM CDT/... At 228 PM MDT/328 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Weskan, or 12 miles east of Cheyenne Wells, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, Wallace and western Logan Counties in west central Kansas, including the following locations... Firstview, Wild Horse and Arapahoe. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 141 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Landspout tornadoes can form with a developing thunderstorm before rain, hail, and even thunder is observed. Landspout tornadoes are not usually associated with a wall cloud and are often difficult to detect with weather radar.
